lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/lazysourcea.lazysourcea.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run lazysourcea.lazysourcea.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.

Task event = new Event(ev.desc, ev.from, ev.to);
ui.showError("oi.. give valid task number pls.\nUsage: delete <number>");
ui.showError("task number out of range lah.");
* Parses raw user input into structured commands and arguments.
* The {@code Parser} class is responsible for:

*
  • Identifying the command type from a string.

*
  • Splitting arguments for tasks such as deadlines and events.
BYE, LIST, TODO, DEADLINE, EVENT, MARK, UNMARK, DELETE, HELP, UNKNOWN, FIND
private static final DateTimeFormatter IN_SLASH = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("d/M/yyyy");
* Parses a raw input string into a structured {@link Parsed} object.
* @param raw the raw user input string
* @return a {@code Parsed} object containing the command type, arguments, and raw input
* Maps a command word string to a {@link CommandType}.
* @return the corresponding {@code CommandType}, or {@code UNKNOWN} if not recognized
* Parses the arguments for a deadline command.
* @param argument the full argument string after the "deadline" keyword
* @return a {@link DeadlineArgs} containing the description and due date
* @throws IllegalArgumentException if the description is empty or "/by" is missing
* Parses the arguments for an event command.
* @param argument the full argument string after the "event" keyword
* @return an {@link EventArgs} containing the description, start, and end times
* @throws IllegalArgumentException if any required part is missing or blank
* Parses a string index into a 0-based integer and validates bounds.
* @param argument the index string (1-based as entered by the user)
* @param upperExclusive the exclusive upper bound of valid indices
* @throws NumberFormatException if the argument is not a number
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if the index is out of range
public int parseIndex(String argument, int upperExclusive) {
* Attempts to parse a date string in ISO or slash format.

* Encapsulates the result of parsing a raw input string.
public Parsed(CommandType type, String arg, String raw) {

public EventArgs(String d, String f, String t) {
* Handles saving and loading tasks from a file.
* The {@code Storage} class ensures that tasks are persisted
* between runs of the chatbot by reading and writing them
* Creates a new {@code Storage} instance using the given path.
* The path is constructed relative to the project directory.
* @param pathParts one or more path components (e.g. "data", "duke.txt")
* Loads tasks from the save file.
* If the file does not exist, an empty list is returned.
* @return a list of {@link Task} objects loaded from the file
* Saves the given list of tasks to the save file.
* If the folder does not exist, it is created automatically.
* @param tasks the list of {@link Task} objects to save
* Represents a {@link Task} with a deadline.
* A deadline task has a description and a due date,
* stored as a {@link LocalDate}. The date is displayed
* but saved in ISO-8601 format ({@code yyyy-MM-dd}).
private static final DateTimeFormatter OUT = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM d yyyy");
* Creates a new {@code Deadline} with the given description and due date.
* @param by the due date of the task as a {@link LocalDate}
* Returns the due date of this deadline task.
* @return the due date as a {@link LocalDate}
* Returns a string representation of this task suitable for saving.
* @return the serialized form of this deadline task
* Returns a string representation of this task for user display.
* @return a human-readable string for this deadline task
* Represents a {@link Task} that spans a period of time.
* An event task has a description, a start time, and an end time.
* Unlike {@link Deadline}, which has a single due date, an event
* specifies both the beginning and end of the activity.
* Creates a new {@code Event} with the given description and time range.
* @param from the start time or date of the event
* @param to the end time or date of the event
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {
* Returns a string representation of this task suitable for saving.
* @return the serialized form of this event task
* Returns a string representation of this task for user display.
* @return a human-readable string for this event task
* Represents a generic task in the task list.
* A task has a textual description and a completion status
* (done or not done). This class is meant to be extended by
* specific task types such as {@link Todo}, {@link Deadline},
* Creates a new {@code Task} with the given description.
* By default, a task is not done.
* @param description textual description of the task
* Returns the status icon for this task.
* @return {@code "X"} if the task is done, otherwise a single space
* Marks this task as not completed.
* Returns a string representation of this task in a format
* Subclasses override this to include their specific type
* @return data string in the format {@code ? | 0/1 | description}
* Returns a string representation of this task for display to the user.
* @return string in the format {@code [ ] description} or {@code [X] description}
* Represents a mutable list of {@link Task} objects.
* Provides methods to add, remove, retrieve, and display tasks.
* The internal list is encapsulated and cannot be modified directly
* Adds a task to the list.
* @param task the {@link Task} to be added
* Returns the number of tasks currently in the list.
* @return the size of the task list
* Retrieves the task at the specified index.
* @param index zero-based index of the task to retrieve
* @return the {@link Task} at the specified index
public Task getTask(int index) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException {
* Removes the task at the specified index.
* @param index zero-based index of the task to remove
public Task removeTask(int index) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException {
* Returns an unmodifiable view of the current task list.
* This ensures external code cannot mutate the internal list
* while still being able to iterate over the tasks.
* @return an unmodifiable {@link List} of {@link Task} objects
* Prints all tasks in the list to standard output.
* If the list is empty, a placeholder message is shown.
* Represents a simple {@link Task} without any date or time attached.
* A todo task only contains a description and its completion status.

* The task is initially not marked as done.

* Returns a string representation of this task suitable for saving.
* @return the serialized form of this todo task
* Returns a string representation of this task for user display.
* @return a human-readable string for this todo task
* Handles all user interactions with the chatbot.
* The {@code Ui} class is responsible for displaying messages,
* reading user input, and printing feedback for commands such
* as adding, deleting, marking, or listing tasks.

* Prints the welcome message, including the logo and basic instructions.
System.out.println("hi. i'm lazysourcea.lazysourcea.\nwhat do you want to do?");
* Prints the farewell message when exiting the chatbot.
* Reads a command entered by the user.
* Prints an error message to the user.
* Prints a list of available commands and their usage.
System.out.println("todo:           adds a todo task. use: todo <desc>");
System.out.println("deadline:       adds a deadline task. use: deadline <desc> /by <date>");
System.out.println("event:          adds an event. use: event <desc> /from <time> /to <time>");
System.out.println("mark:           marks a task. use: mark <number>");
System.out.println("unmark:         unmarks a task. use: unmark <number>");
System.out.println("delete:         deletes a task. use: delete <number>");
* Prints a confirmation message when a task is added.
* @param task the task that was added
* @param size the new size of the task list
public void showAdded(Task task, int size) {
System.out.println("now you have " + size + " task(s) in the list.");
* Prints a confirmation message when a task is deleted.
* @param task the task that was removed
* @param size the new size of the task list
public void showDeleted(Task task, int size) {
System.out.println("now you have " + size + " tasks in the list.");
* Prints a confirmation message when a task is marked as done.

* Prints the entire list of tasks.
* @param taskList the list of tasks to display
* Displays all tasks whose description contains the given keyword.
* The search is case-insensitive and matches any substring within
* the task's {@code toString()} representation. Results are shown
* in a numbered list, similar to {@link #showList(lazysourcea.task.TaskList)}.
* If no tasks match the keyword, a placeholder message is printed.
* @param keyword  the search keyword to look for in task descriptions
public void showFindResults(TaskList taskList, String keyword) {
